boardgame.description: Ticket to Ride: Nordic Countries takes you on a Nordic adventure through Denmark, Finland, Norway, and Sweden as you travel to the great northern cities of Copenhagen, Oslo, Helsinki, and Stockholm. This version was initially available only in the Nordic Countries of Denmark, Norway, Sweden, and Finland; a worldwide limited-edition release occurred in August 2008 and it has since been kept in print again by Days of Wonder._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The goal in _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Nordic_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; remains the same as base Ticket to Ride: collect and play cards to place your trains on the board, attempting to connect the different cities on your ticket cards. The map incorporates tunnels from Europe and also has routes containing ferries. Ferries will require a certain number of Locomotives to be played, as well as other cards, in order to be claimed. Locomotives are handled a bit differently as well. On your turn you may take 2 Locomotives if you want, but you can only use them on ferries, tunnels, or the special 9 length route._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Unlike the USA or Europe maps, Nordic is designed for 2-3 players only and has a heavier focus on blocking your opponent and more aggressive play._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Although not an official expansion for this set, Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 5 – United Kingdom _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Pennsylvania can be used as an expansion for Nordic Countries, although limited to the three players included in this set. Nordic Countries includes three sets of 40 trains, with 5 spare for each colour; the UK map in Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 5 – United Kingdom _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Pennsylvania requires 35 trains and the Pennsylvania map requires 45 trains._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Part of the Ticket to Ride series._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

This game is brand new. Shipping/Handling will be 10.00. Get a copy of this great addition to the Ticket to Ride series while they last! The distributor has sold out! -------------------------------------------------------- From Game Box: Ticket to Ride Nordic Countries takes you on a Nordic adventure through Denmark, Finland, Norway and Sweden as you travel to the great northern cities of Copenhagen, Oslo, Helsinki and Stockholm. Visit Norway’s beautiful fjords and the magnificent mountain scenery on the Rauma Railway. Breathe in t he salt air of the busy Swedish ports on the Baltic Sea. Ride through the Danish countryside where Vikings once walked. Hop-on the Finnish railway and travel across the Arctic Circle to the land of the Midnight Sun. Ticket to Ride Nordic Countries is the next installment in this best-selling train adventure series. Players collect cards of various types of train cars that enable them to claim railway routes and pass through tunnels and onto ferries, as they connect cities throughout the Nordic countries. Ticket to Ride Nordic Countries is designed specifically for 2 or 3 players. As with previous versions, the game reamins elegant; can be learned in 5 minutes; and provides hours of fun for families and experienced gamers alike. Hop on board! (Quoted from box back) Game Contains: 1. 1 Board map of Nordic Countries 2. 120 Colored Train Cars 3. 110 Train car cards 4. 46 Destination Tickets 5. 1 Globetrotter Bonus card 6. 3 Wooden Scoring Markers 7. 1 Rules booklet 8. 1 Days of Wonder Online access number # Number of Players: 2-3 # Age: 8+ # Approximate Playing Time: 30-60 minutes

Days of Wonder - Ticket To Ride: Nordic Countries Language: English Players: 2 to 3 Age: 8+ Duration: 30 to 60 min Weight: 1.365 kg New - mint condition - unopened - still in shrink wrap. Theme: Ticket to Ride: Nordic Countries takes you on a Nordic adventure through Denmark, Finland, Norway and Sweden as you travel to the great northern cities of Copenhagen, Oslo, Helsinki and Stockholm. This version was initially available only in the Nordic Countries of Denmark, Norway, Sweden and Finland; a worldwide limited-edition release occurred in August 2008. See Details (more info) or below for complete selling, payment and shipping conditions.
